text: The Commanding General, subject to the approval of the Commander-in-Chief, is authorized to make and publish regulations for the government of the militia in all matters not specifically provided for by law, conforming the same to the practice and regulations of the Army so far as they may be applicable.
historical:
Prior Codifications

1973 Ed., § 39-905.

DC CODE § 49-805

Current through December 11, 2012

heading.catch_text: Commanding General authorized to make regulations.
